(Decision taken in 428th EC Meeting (E File-9778) 
Sub: Removal of at-grade junctions from National Highways and construction of 
passenger cross movement facility in rural areas on the completed 4/6 lane 
National Highways -reg. 
In order to avoid vehicle vehicle & vehicle pedestrians conflict on at-grade 
junctions on National Highways, it has been decided in the 428th Executive Committe e 
meeting to eliminate at-grade junctions by providing Vehicular underpasses (VUP) and Light 
commercial vehicular underpasses (LVUP) in a phased manner. To begin with about 10 
proposal of VUP /LVUP in a financial year per Regional officers are planned. 
Implementation of removal of at-grade junctions will be monitored through data 
lake portal which will capture all activities since identification till implementation. The 
entire procedure of submission forwarding / approval of the proposals therefor be 
updated on data lake portal. 2 
The PIUs shall be responsible for identification of such locations and compile data 
in a format on the data lake portal. Regional Officers prioritise based on criterion given 
below and then forward the same to Member concerned at HQ, Member concerned taking 
note of the overall projections direct ROs/PIUs to submit the detailed proposal. The 
proposals shall be approved as per the extant delegation of powers for Change of Scope/ 
O&M works. 3. 
Above exercise will exclude the junctions already covered under the list of 4. 
blackspots maintained by MoRTH, for which the delegation as prescribed in policy circular 
dated 1.1.31/2019 dated 19.12.2019 shall continue to be followed. 
For provision of VUP / LVUP criteria already laid down in the Manual shall be 
followed and prioritise on the basis of junction with NH, SH, Industrial parks, others 
category roads. Junction under specific category say junction with NH further be prioritise 
based on traffic and accidents. For VUP in urban areas three spans are recommended to 
facilitate u turn movement. While planning, it also need to be ensured that adequate sight 
distance is available on VUP/LVUP locations. In this regard guidelines issued vide policy 
circular no. 10. 1.18/2019 dated 30.04.2019 may be followed. All the above measures are 
suggested for completed four/six lanes NH. 5. 
6. This issues with the approval of Competent Authority. sRe
